message: but I'm not seeing it now.. can anyone point me in the right direction here?
I thought at one point I'd seen a flag that would let me run south migrations in a mode where they auto-answered yes or not to things like tables that can be deleted, etc.
(aside: Holy crap google's new indexing is fast. This post is already the second result for when I search for answers to this question :| )
Hmm, what are you referring to - prompts during "./manage.py migrate"? In that case --noinput should work, it's the underlying Django code running post-syncdb hooks.
@andrewgodwin awesome, that makes sense.. it didn't occur to me that it wasn't South doing the prompting :P
